description.header: Do business your way in a professional workspace
description.content:
Located in the thriving Cool Springs area of Franklin, Tennessee, these sought-after office spaces for rent occupy part of the first and the entire third floor of this remarkable 170,000 sq. ft. five-story Mallory Lane new build. Meeting space, boardrooms, conference rooms, training rooms; all these spaces have an open-plan design, with floor-to-ceiling windows for an abundance of natural light. You can even rent this Mallory Green business center’s prestigious address as a virtual office, complete with call handling and mail forwarding.
As well as being conveniently close to Interstate 65, U.S. Route 431, and Tennessee State Route 96, you’re only 20 minutes’ drive south of downtown Nashville. And Nashville International Airport is only a 25-minute drive away. WiFi, admin facilities, a large car park, a patio overlooking a tree-lined natural stream, a plethora of relaxing spaces—Mallory Green is perfectly set up to ensure you can maximize productivity and work in absolute comfort.
And you’ll be in good company too. As well as working alongside like-minded professionals within this Mallory Green business hub, the likes of Verizon, Mars, Incorporated, and Nissan have bases close by. Fancy a stroll? Liberty Park is close by and Cool Springs boasts numerous venues for food, entertainment, and retail therapy, including a Walmart Supercenter and AMC Thoroughbred movie theater. There are picnic areas and a healthy options food market close by, as well as Orangetheory Fitness and Anytime Fitness gyms. If you’ll be staying a night or two, Hyatt House and Staybridge hotels are a stone’s throw away.

description.header: Do business your way in a professional workspace
description.content:
Elevate your business at One Oxford Center—Pittsburgh’s prime new workspace. Downtown Pittsburgh has a definite work-hard, play-hard vibe that makes it the perfect place to do business. One Oxford Center is located in the heart of Pittsburgh's thriving financial services, healthcare, and technology district. A glistening glass tower in the city’s skyline, it boasts 360-degree views across the urban landscape and a prestigious tenant roster that includes Morgan Lewis and TriState Capital. Located just off the Parkway (I-376), the most prominent highway in the Pittsburgh metro area, you’re minutes from the airport and the remainder of the interstates. It’s also a paper plane’s throw from an abundance of art and culture—explore the retail and food outlets of Market Square, the beautiful green space of Firstside Park, or the charm of Fourth Avenue Historic District.
Recently renovated to a high standard, this iconic One Oxford Center office tower is sure to impress from the get-go with its five-story interior atrium and contemporary outdoor terrace and garden. Both floors offer a column-free design and high ceilings, letting in floods of natural light from the continuous glass windows that encompass the building’s striking structure. As well as a suite of designer offices, meeting rooms, and communal areas, entrepreneurs benefit from an extensive new food court and news stand, as well as banking and postal services, private dining facilities, a full-service 70,000 sq. ft. fitness center, bicycle parking, and an attached garage with integral access to an additional 1,600 spaces at the Boulevard of the Allies' garage and Macy's garage.

description.content:
Located in the thriving Cool Springs area of Franklin, Tennessee, these sought-after office spaces for rent occupy part of the first and the entire third floor of this remarkable 170,000 sq. ft. five-story Mallory Lane new build. Meeting space, boardrooms, conference rooms, training rooms; all these spaces have an open-plan design, with floor-to-ceiling windows for an abundance of natural light. You can even rent this Mallory Green business center’s prestigious address as a virtual office, complete with call handling and mail forwarding.
As well as being conveniently close to Interstate 65, U.S. Route 431, and Tennessee State Route 96, you’re only 20 minutes’ drive south of downtown Nashville. And Nashville International Airport is only a 25-minute drive away. WiFi, admin facilities, a large car park, a patio overlooking a tree-lined natural stream, a plethora of relaxing spaces—Mallory Green is perfectly set up to ensure you can maximize productivity and work in absolute comfort.
And you’ll be in good company too. As well as working alongside like-minded professionals within this Mallory Green business hub, the likes of Verizon, Mars, Incorporated, and Nissan have bases close by. Fancy a stroll? Liberty Park is close by and Cool Springs boasts numerous venues for food, entertainment, and retail therapy, including a Walmart Supercenter and AMC Thoroughbred movie theater. There are picnic areas and a healthy options food market close by, as well as Orangetheory Fitness and Anytime Fitness gyms. description.header: Do business your way in a professional workspace
description.content:
Elevate your business at One Oxford Center—Pittsburgh’s prime new workspace. Downtown Pittsburgh has a definite work-hard, play-hard vibe that makes it the perfect place to do business. One Oxford Center is located in the heart of Pittsburgh's thriving financial services, healthcare, and technology district. A glistening glass tower in the city’s skyline, it boasts 360-degree views across the urban landscape and a prestigious tenant roster that includes Morgan Lewis and TriState Capital. Located just off the Parkway (I-376), the most prominent highway in the Pittsburgh metro area, you’re minutes from the airport and the remainder of the interstates. It’s also a paper plane’s throw from an abundance of art and culture—explore the retail and food outlets of Market Square, the beautiful green space of Firstside Park, or the charm of Fourth Avenue Historic District.
Recently renovated to a high standard, this iconic One Oxford Center office tower is sure to impress from the get-go with its five-story interior atrium and contemporary outdoor terrace and garden. Both floors offer a column-free design and high ceilings, letting in floods of natural light from the continuous glass windows that encompass the building’s striking structure. As well as a suite of designer offices, meeting rooms, and communal areas, entrepreneurs benefit from an extensive new food court and news stand, as well as banking and postal services, private dining facilities, a full-service 70,000 sq. ft. fitness center, bicycle parking, and an attached garage with integral access to an additional 1,600 spaces at the Boulevard of the Allies' garage and Macy's garage.

description.content:
Basing your business north of Dallas gives opportunity for a diversity of things to do, offering more than 170 restaurants and 22 hotels, all within 4.5 square miles. The prestigious Colonnade building overlooks the North Dallas Tollway, the connection between big business and the airport, that just happens to be a five-minute drive from the office. When clients fly in, be sure to discuss ambitious plans over the finest in Texan French cuisine at III Forks restaurant. Or simply welcome them in through the Colonnade’s three-story atrium lobby area that includes fountains, gardens, a bar and barista, a convenience store, and a cafeteria.
This Class AA office space is a two-time award winner of the famous BOMA Building of the Year, and is home to The Colonnade and includes coworking spaces, meeting rooms, and mail forwarding. You can also utilize a super-fast WiFi, friendly admin staff, and the on-site workout facilities for the ideal balance of work and play. You’ll find that the surrounding area is serviced by modern tramlines, bus routes, and also plenty of taxi companies, so you’ll never be at a loss for transportation. When it comes to exploring the entertainment nearby, you won’t be at a loss of options with multiple cinemas, Addison Improv, and Pete’s Dueling Piano Bar to name a few.

description.header: Do business your way in a professional workspace
description.content:
The Falchi Building at 31-00 47th Avenue, Long Island City, near 47th Ave and 31st St. is a great coworking space. The Falchi building is a five-minute walk from the 33 St. stop on the Number 7 line. This location is an attractive alternative to Brooklyn, within the new nucleus of creative and tech innovation outside of Manhattan.
Built in 1922, the Falchi Building was originally a warehouse for the famous New York Gimbels department store. Now the warehouse has a new life as a community for startups, entrepreneurs, art galleries, and delicious eateries. Its spacious loft style has made it popular with the tech, media, small manufacturing, and jewelry businesses that now inhabit the building’s five stories. Food vendors and the Conception Gallery reside on the bottom floor. A rooftop deck will soon be open with open-air seating and an urban garden.

description.header: A place for your business to grow
description.content:
Discover Slabtown – a creative hub of productivity.
Nestled in the heart of Portland’s historic NW Slabtown you’ll find the flexible offices of Slabtown. Once an industrial area, this spectacular part of Portland is now a thriving co-working community surrounded by eclectic boutiques and art galleries. Leland James occupies part of the first floor and all the second floor of this ultra-contemporary office building. As well as a variety of private, meeting and communal spaces with superfast, unlimited Wi-Fi, you’ll benefit from a selection of shops and restaurants on the ground floor, exclusive access to the second-floor sky porch, and outdoor decking surrounded by wraparound eco roofs on the fourth.
For added convenience, there are bike and car parking spaces, locker rooms and showers on-site, as well as grocery stores, restaurants, fitness centers and hotels on your doorstep. Leland James can be your home away from home – especially as there are more than 1,600 new urban apartment units within a five-minute stroll. Fancy exploring the area? Lush parks and hiking trails are a few minutes’ walk away, and you can find endless entertainment downtown – just a short drive from the office.

description.header: An inspiring environment to do your best work
description.content:
Situated along Phoenix’s tech corridor, The Quarter is a truly inspiring area to dock your business. In fact, many global firms and tech startups alike already call it home. Watch your productivity soar in a workspace that has everything your team needs to feel right at home and ready for work. Super-fast WiFi, great in-house services, cool climate controls, an on-site deli, and most importantly, a ready supply of killer coffee. Choose from light and airy private or shared offices to rent, meeting rooms to hire, and flexible spaces to hold a meeting of the minds. You’ll even have access to an exclusive balcony—great for entertaining clients. 

With the 28-acre, 1.2 million sq. ft. lifestyle center of Scottsdale Quarter on your doorstep, you won’t be short of world-class places to dine, relax, and find inspiration for next big presentation. And if you’re arriving by car, finding a parking space will never be a problem with a mixture of private and shared places on tap.
